0.title: When did I insult Hindu culture: Kamra to VHP on show cancellation
0.article_body: Two days after a bar in Gurugram cancelled comedian Kunal Kamra's show after members of the Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) threatened to protest, Kamra on Sunday wrote a letter to VHP. "When did I disrespect Hindu culture? If there is any clip or show, please show it to me as well," he wrote in the letter.

1.title: Prabhas breaks down after uncle Krishnam Raju's death, pic surfaces
1.article_body: Actor Prabhas broke down after the demise of his uncle, veteran actor and former Union Minister Krishnam Raju. Pictures and videos of him breaking down at the late actor's residence have surfaced online. Veteran actor Chiranjeevi can be seen consoling Prabhas and holding his hand. As per PTI, Krishnam Raju was suffering from post-COVID-19 ailments.

2.title: Security increased in Varanasi ahead of court order on Gyanvapi case
2.article_body: Ahead of the Varanasi district court's order on the Gyanvapi mosque case on Monday, prohibitory orders were put in place and security was tightened in the city. Both Hindu and Muslim sides concluded their arguments on the maintainability of the suit in August. Police have intensified checking in the district's border areas, hotels and guest houses.

3.title: Specially-abled Swiggy delivery agent delivers food in motorised wheelchair, video viral
3.article_body: A video of a specially-abled Swiggy delivery agent using a motorised wheelchair to deliver food has gone viral on social media. The video was reposted on Twitter by Swati Maliwal, Chairperson of Delhi Commission for Women, who praised the Swiggy delivery agent. "Of course life is difficult, but we have learned never to give up...Salute to this spirit," Maliwal wrote.

4.title: Future of women's tennis burns brightly: Billie Jean on Iga-Ons US Open final
4.article_body: Former tennis player Billie Jean King took to Twitter following Iga Swiatek's US Open win and wrote, "Congratulations to Iga Swiatek, the first Polish woman to win the US Open. And cheers to Ons Jabeur on an incredible battle." She added, "Future of women's tennis burns so brightly." Ex-Polish player Agnieszka Radwanska tweeted, "You just rock it!! Huge congratulations Swiatek."

5.title: Would never change anything about my journey: Actor Kartik Aaryan
5.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has said that he will never change anything about his journey. "Thankfully I started when I was 20, almost like a child artist, but it's been a journey with ups and downs and I've seen hits and flops," he stated. Kartik added that he is enjoying the success of his recent films 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Dhamaka'.

6.title: Google Play Store’s new app review policy to bring more genuine reviews: Report
6.article_body: Google is reportedly bringing a new app review policy to make app ratings and reviews on Play Store more genuine. Under the policy, user-submitted reviews and ratings will be held up by around 24 hours before they go public. Google also warned against posting the same review multiple times as well as reviews for the same content from multiple accounts.

7.title: Indian cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy gets engaged to weightlifting coach, shares pics
7.article_body: India Women cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy got engaged to performance coach and weightlifting coach Arjun Hoysala. The duo took to Instagram to share pictures, with Arjun writing, "And, she said 'Yes'." Arjun has also played a first-class match for Karnataka and has represented Belagavi Panthers in Karnataka Premier League.

8.title: Kareena praises 'Brahmastra', calls it an 'unbelievable experience'
8.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to Instagram Stories and praised Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra'. "Unbelievable experience (five stars). Well done to the entire team," she wrote. Kareena watched the film with her actor-husband Saif Ali Khan and their son Taimur on Friday. The film has been released in five languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam.

9.title: Man throws slipper at mosque in Karnataka, video surfaces
9.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man throwing a slipper at a local mosque in Karnataka's Ballari district. Alok Kumar, Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, Karnataka, tweeted that the accused had been taken into custody. "Appropriate legal action is being taken against them," Kumar said.

10.title: WB CM Mamata says she's poor, but uses iPhone worth lakhs: BJP
10.article_body: BJP national vice president Dilip Ghosh took a jibe at West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and Abhishek Banerjee, for claiming to be poor, but using iPhones "worth lakhs of rupees". "Remember what 'Didimoni' (Mamata Banerjee) said? Talk on FaceTime. FaceTime is only available on iPhones. How many of you use FaceTime?" Ghosh said during a public meeting.

11.title: Soldier martyred as parachute fails to open during exercise in Leh
11.article_body: Paratrooper Naik Suraj Pal on Sunday was martyred after his parachute failed to open during a mountain strike exercise in the Leh-Ladakh region. "We salute the resolute courage of the paratrooper and stand by his family in this hour of grief," Indian Army's Central Command stated. Last week, a commando was martyred in a similar exercise in the Leh sector.

12.title: Salman's Mumbai house was recced by Sidhu Moosewala murder accused: Police
12.article_body: An accused in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case conducted a recce of actor Salman Khan's house in Mumbai on gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's instruction, police have said. This was revealed by the accused Kapil Pandit during his interrogation, Punjab Police DGP Gaurav Yadav said. A threat letter was sent to Salman and his father Salim in June this year.

13.title: PM condoles demise of Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swaroopanand Saraswati
13.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his grief at the demise of Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati on Sunday. "My condolences to his followers in this time of grief. Om Shanti!" PM Modi said. Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati passed away at the age of 98 at the Shridham Jhoteshwar Ashram in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur.

14.title: 20-yr-old strangled to death by father over her romantic relationship in UP
14.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death by her father for having a romantic relationship with a man in Uttar Pradesh's Jhinjhana, police said. The victim had eloped with her boyfriend and returned home after a few days. The father has confessed that he committed the crime as he felt his daughter had tarnished the name of his family.

15.title: Turkey says Greek Coast Guard fired on cargo ship amid tensions
15.article_body: A cargo ship sailing in international waters in the Aegean Sea came under fire from two Greek Coast Guard vessels on Saturday, the Turkish Coast Guard said. No casualties due to the shooting were reported. Lately, there has been a flare up in tensions between Greece and Turkey over Greek military deployment on several islands near the Turkish coast.

16.title: Challenge you to an open discussion on corruption: Siddaramaiah to K'taka CM
16.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Sunday challenged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to an "open discussion on corruption". "We are always ready. You fix the time and venue, and we will come," Siddaramaiah said.  "BJP leaders are claiming that they will expose scandals of our time. I challenge them to do that. I am ready to face it," he added.

17.title: Pakistan to bowl first in Asia Cup 2022 final against SL, playing XIs announced
17.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam won the toss and elected to bowl first against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2022 final in Dubai. Pakistan have made two changes to their playing XI, with Shadab Khan and Naseem Shah returning to the side in place of Usman Qadir and Hasan Ali. Sri Lanka are fielding the same playing XI.

18.title: When I worked in Telugu films, actresses were for love scenes, songs: Amala
18.article_body: Actress Amala Paul, who worked in four Telugu films between 2011 and 2015, revealed that she could not connect with the Telugu film industry. "The kind of films that they were making...was very different. There would always be two actresses and we'd be there for the love scenes, songs," she added. "Everything was very glamorous," she further stated.

19.title: PM Modi is 'soul of country', can't be defeated: Maha Minister Khade
19.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Suresh Khade has claimed PM Narendra Modi was the "soul of the country" and was "undefeatable". "Atal Bihari Vajpayee and Indira Gandhi lost elections in their time, but Modi will never lose," Khade asserted. PM Modi lies in the hearts of the people of India, Khade further added.

20.title: Pune district reports 5 COVID-19 deaths during Ganesh Chaturthi
20.article_body: The Pune district reported five COVID-19 deaths during the 10-day-long Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations. Health department officials said that due to the festivities, daily cases may rise over the next few days. Dr Pradeep Awate, state surveillance officer, urged people to wear masks and said, "At present, a subvariant of Omicron BA.2.75 is dominating other covid variants in the state."

21.title: Will soon launch national party, formulate its policies: T'gana CM
21.article_body: Telangana CM and TRS chief K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday said he would launch a national party and formulate its policies soon. "There has been a consensus on the alternative national agenda after prolonged discussions with intellectuals, economists and experts from various fields like we did before the start of [the] Telangana movement," an official release from Rao's office said.

22.title: Pune Police recieve 1,043 noise complaints during Ganpati festival
22.article_body: The Pune Police received 1,043 noise complaints between August 31 and September 10, and the highest number of complaints were received on September 9, the final day of the Ganpati festival. Majority of the complaints were about loud music at Ganesh pandals beyond the 10 pm deadline. Police Commissioner, Amitabh Gupta, said that appropriate action will be taken.

23.title: IMD issues yellow alert for Mumbai predicting rains over next 2 days
23.article_body: The IMD has issued a fresh yellow alert for Mumbai predicting heavy rainfall with thunderstorms over the next two days. The department added that the temperatures in the city will increase, despite the rains. Meteorologists say Mumbai has recorded 174 mm of rain this month until September 9, which is comparatively on the lighter side.

24.title: Liberian national arrested for trafficking 3 Mumbai men to Myanmar
24.article_body: A Liberian national was arrested by Mumbai's Bandra Police for duping three people with job offers and getting them trafficked. Police say the man promised the three men a job in Thailand but once they reached there, their passports were confiscated and they were held captive inside a bunker in Myanmar. The MEA is currently working on getting them back.

25.title: 2 sisters jump from 11th floor of building in Noida; 1 dies
25.article_body: Two sisters allegedly jumped from the eleventh floor of a building in Noida's Sector-96 on Saturday, police said. The elder sister, aged around 18, died on the spot, while her younger sister, aged 17, was shifted to a hospital. Both of them reportedly got into a dispute with their family members and left the house before jumping off the building.

26.title: Rajpath erased from signboards near India Gate after being renamed
26.article_body: The old name of New Delhi's ceremonial avenue, Rajpath, has been taken off the signages mounted around the periphery of the India Gate hexagon after it was renamed 'Kartavya Path'. The move comes after the civic body recently issued a notice approving the renaming of the historic road at its special meeting on September 7.

27.title: Viral video shows King Charles gesturing angrily to aide to clear his desk
27.article_body: A video showing UK's King Charles III gesturing angrily to his aide to clear the desk during his accession ceremony has gone viral online. The 73-year-old is seen in the video prompting his aide to remove a tray of pens from his desk. He was proclaimed the King at the ceremony in St James's Palace, London.

28.title: Assam Congress leader Kamrul Islam Choudhury resigns from party
28.article_body: Assam Pradesh Congress Committee (APCC) General Secretary Kamrul Islam Choudhury resigned from the party's primary membership on Sunday. In a letter to party chief Sonia Gandhi, he said the present instability of Congress in Assam due to directionless and confused leadership of APCC during the last few months has left no reason for him to continue as the party's member.

29.title: Alia shares videos of audiences throwing confetti during Brahmastra screening
29.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to her Instagram Stories and re-posted a couple of videos showing viewers throwing confetti during the screening of 'Brahmastra' in theatres. In a video, fans could be seen cheering and throwing confetti as 'Allari Motha', the Telugu version of 'Dance Ka Bhoot', played on the screen. According to makers, 'Brahmastra' has collected ₹160 crore globally.

30.title: Was extremely nervous: Shiamak Davar recalls meeting Queen Elizabeth II
30.article_body: Choreographer Shiamak Davar, condoling the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, said, "I'd heard she was ailing. When she passed away, I felt very sad." He also recalled meeting the Queen in 2017 and said he was "extremely nervous". "I was wondering what I should wear...Though it was formal, I made it Indian because I'm proud to be Indian," said Shiamak.

31.title: 2 interstate drug peddlers arrested in Hyd, 1 litre of hash oil seized
31.article_body: Hyderabad's Vanasthalipuram Police on September 9 arrested two interstate drug peddlers from Sushma crossroads. The accused purchased 1 litre of hash oil from a drug dealer in Visakhapatnam for ₹40,000. The police arrested them while the two were waiting to board a bus to Hyderabad. The accused concealed the hash oil container in a bag to evade the police.

32.title: Delhi Police van rams into scooty, accused of destroying evidence; 2 hurt
32.article_body: A video showing a Delhi Police van ramming into a scooty and injuring two women has surfaced online. The women have alleged that the police personnel were in an inebriated condition and also tried to wipe the blood off the road to destroy incriminating evidence. They also offered money to the victims to not lodge a complaint, reports said.

33.title: 3 killed as US-made Black Hawk crashes during Taliban exercise
33.article_body: A US-made Black Hawk helicopter crashed during a training exercise in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Saturday, killing three Afghan crew members, the Taliban's Defence Ministry said. Another five people were injured in the incident, the ministry added. Several US-manufactured military equipment, including helicopters, were seized by the Taliban after US forces withdrew from Afghanistan last year.

34.title: Sky is the limit: World no. 1 Swiatek after her maiden US Open win
34.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek said the "sky is the limit" after winning her maiden US Open title. "It's something that I wasn't expecting for sure...I'm proud, also surprised a little bit. Just happy that I was able to do that," she added. Swiatek beat Ons Jabeur 6-2, 7-6(7-5) in final. Overall, it was the 21-year-old's third Grand Slam title.

35.title: Kejriwal, corruption synonymous; he has no right to remain CM: BJP
35.article_body: The BJP on Sunday alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and corruption have become synonymous, adding that he has no right to remain in the post. "How can you claim to be 'hardcore honest'? People have understood you are 'hardcore corrupt'. You have no right to remain in the chair of the CM," said BJP's national spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

36.title: Blindly adopting tech could be counterproductive: RBI Executive Director
36.article_body: The Executive Director of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), Ajay Choudhary, said that the financial sector "blindly" adopting latest technologies without understanding the biases could be counterproductive. "RBI’s focus area is innovation, while innovations are desirable they also need to be responsible," he added. Choudhary said that the risks posed by new innovations should be well understood.

37.title: Akhtar shares 'BP monitor, inhaler, tablets' meme ahead of Pak-SL final, says 'All ready?'
37.article_body: Ahead of the Pakistan-Sri Lanka Asia Cup 2022 final, former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar took to Twitter to share a meme showing a BP monitoring device, an inhaler and tablets with the caption, "All set for Asia Cup 2022 final". Akhtar wrote, "Sab tayyar? (All ready?)" A fan jokingly commented, "Get ready to break TVs as well."

38.title: I tell daughter Palak not to marry, I don't believe in it: Shweta Tiwari
38.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari revealed she tells her daughter Palak Tiwari not to get married. Shweta added she doesn't believe in the institution of marriage. Shweta has divorced Raja Chaudhary and Abhinav Kohli in the past. "I want her to think well before taking the plunge. Just because you're in a relationship, it doesn't have to culminate into marriage," she stated.

39.title: Sorry state of affairs: HC to Delhi govt on plea of kids suffering from cerebral palsy
39.article_body: Delhi High Court has warned the AAP-led Delhi government of action over the plea of two children, seeking support under disabilities law. Terming it a sorry state of affairs, Justice Gaurang Kanth said it "miserably failed" to carry out its duty as "State" towards the children. He noted the Delhi government "wasn't in a position to consider" their case positively.

40.title: Man kills wife with frying pan in Noida for refusing to cook food
40.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed his wife with a frying pan in their house at Shramik Kunj in Noida's sector 66 area on Saturday morning, after she refused to cook food for him. The couple was alone in the house when the incident took place, reports said. The couple's neighbour informed the police about the crime.

41.title: Delhi needs more educated LG: AAP as LG approves CBI probe in alleged bus scam
41.article_body: After Delhi LG VK Saxena approved a CBI probe into the alleged corruption in the procurement of 1,000 low-floor buses by Delhi Transport Corporation, AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said, "Delhi needs a more educated LG." "[He] has no clue what he's signing on," Bharadwaj said. "[He's] facing many serious allegations of corruption...To divert attention, he's making such enquiries," Bharadwaj added.

42.title: Reliance can explore reorganisation to list subsidiaries: Report
42.article_body: A Kotak Institutional Equities report has said that Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Ltd can explore the reorganisation of the company into three independent entities for different verticals to list subsidiaries. It added that this would help prevent any holding company discount in Reliance as and when it lists subsidiaries. It would also help Reliance prepare for eventual management change.

43.title: I wasn't even considered for my role in 'Jersey': Prit Kamani
43.article_body: Actor Prit Kamani, speaking about his role in 'Jersey', has said that he was not even considered in 'Jersey' as he was already playing the lead in other projects. "For me, no role is big or small...'Jersey' is a special film since I am very close to my father as I wanted to give something back to him," he stated.

44.title: US Open champ Iga's tweet on spotting 'Friends' actor Perry during final goes viral
44.article_body: World number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek's tweet on spotting 'Friends' actor Matthew Perry during the US Open 2022 final has gone viral. Sharing a GIF of Perry's character 'Chandler Bing' from Friends, Iga wrote, "Me when I really wanted to be focused but I saw @MatthewPerry on the screen during the changeover. Could this BE any more exciting?"

45.title: They are not letting the model set: Ramiz Raja on India not reaching Asia Cup final
45.article_body: Talking about India failing to reach Asia Cup 2022 final, Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja said, "India went down only because they are not letting the model set. They are making too many changes." He added, "They have a bigger pool of players with which they are experimenting." He further attributed Pakistan's success to not changing the winning model.

46.title: Wonderful that we don't live in time where language is barrier: Ranveer
46.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh won the Most Popular Hindi Actor in South India award at the South Indian International Movie Awards (SIIMA). While receiving the award, Ranveer said, "There used to be a time when language was a barrier, but how wonderful it is that we don't live in such a time anymore." Actor Allu Arjun won the Best Actor award.

47.title: Link startups with industry as equal stakeholders: Jitendra Singh
47.article_body: In order to ensure sustainable startups, Minister of State for Science and Technology, Jitendra Singh, said that startups and industry should be linked from the beginning as equal stakeholders. He added that his Ministry was reaching out to startups and providing seed funding for incubation and quality research. Singh also said that India currently ranks third in the startup ecosystem.

48.title: 14 gold bars weighing over 2 kg seized from Assam bus, 3 held
48.article_body: In a joint operation, Assam Police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) arrested three people and seized 14 gold bars weighing 2.323 kg from a passenger bus in Karbi Anglong district on Saturday night. A naka checking was set up by the police and CRPF personnel at the Lahorijan area based on secret information.

49.title: Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati passes away aged 98
49.article_body: Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati passed away aged 98 on Sunday in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur. He had inherited the title of Shankaracharya of Dwarka in 1982. He had become a freedom fighter in the Quit India movement in 1942 and was known as 'Revolutionary Sadhu'. In 1950, he had become a 'dandi sanyasi'.

50.title: He's a great player and a star: Liverpool's Firmino on teammate Carvalho
50.article_body: Liverpool forward Roberto Firmino praised teammate Fabio Carvalho, saying the 20-year-old is a great player. "I confess that I had watched some of his games before he came to Liverpool, so I was already impressed by the way he played," he added. "He's a star...he's also a very close friend," Firmino further said. Carvalho joined Liverpool from Fulham in July.

51.title: WhatsApp may soon allow users to search messages by date: Report
51.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature that will allow users to search for a message by date, WABetaInfo reported. A 'calendar' icon will reportedly appear when a user searches for a message in a conversation. Upon clicking it, the user will be able to jump to a certain date and read all messages in the conversation received on that date.

52.title: Ranveer Singh named Most Popular Hindi Actor in South India at SIIMA 2022
52.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh was named the Most Popular Hindi Actor in South India at the South Indian International Movie Awards 2022 (SIIMA). The award ceremony was held in Bangalore on September 10. The awards for Telugu and Kannada films were announced on Saturday, while Tamil and Malayalam winners will be awarded tonight.

53.title: Ready with full force: Kapil on new season of ‘The Kapil Sharma Show’
53.article_body: Comedian-turned-actor Kapil Sharma said the team of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' is "ready with full force" to bring some entertainment in its new season. Kapil said, during the break, he had "a lot of time to introspect" on what new elements he can bring to the show. The first episode of the new season aired on September 10.

54.title: Discussion on B'luru flood likely to make Karnataka Assembly session stormy
54.article_body: Karnataka Legislature's Monsoon Session, starting Monday, is likely to be stormy as the Opposition is ready to raise issues like Bengaluru floods and infrastructure problems. Damage caused by rains and floods is expected to be discussed. Leader of the Opposition Siddaramaiah recently demanded a white paper regarding the clearing of encroachments and infrastructural worries in Bengaluru.

55.title: Enjoyed 'Brahmastra', second part is going to be huge: Hansal Mehta
55.article_body: Director Hansal Mehta took to Twitter to share that he "really enjoyed" watching 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' at the theatre. "So much respect for the passion and perseverance of Ayan Mukerji," he wrote, adding, "I really hope this film works wonders." He also mentioned that the film's sequel, officially titled 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev', "is going to be huge".

56.title: Stuck in Bengaluru traffic, doctor runs 3 km to reach OT on time
56.article_body: A Bengaluru-based doctor, who was getting late for his surgery because of the traffic, abandoned his car and ran to the hospital to reach the operation theatre (OT) on time. Gastroenterology surgeon Dr Govind Nandakumar was en route to Manipal Hospital for the emergency laparoscopic gallbladder surgery. "I ran three [kilometre] to hospital and was in time for...surgery," he said.

57.title: Abhishek Banerjee's relative stopped from flying, summoned by ED
57.article_body: Trinamool Congress leader Abhishek Banerjee's sister-in-law Maneka Gambhir was stopped at Kolkata airport when she was about to travel to Bangkok. She was informed that she wasn't allowed to travel out of India since a look out notice was issued against her by Enforcement Directorate. Gambhir has been summoned by ED in connection with the coal smuggling scam on Monday.

58.title: Steven Spielberg's memoir 'The Fabelmans' debuts at Toronto Film Fest
58.article_body: Steven Spielberg's autobiographical film 'The Fabelmans' debuted at the Toronto International Film Festival. Spielberg said the memoir, which he clarified isn't his "swan song", was something he had thought about for a long time. He said 'The Fabelmans' was worth making as it brought him closer to his sisters. He also called it a way of bringing his parents back.

59.title: US marks 21st anniversary of 9/11 terror attacks
59.article_body: US President Joe Biden will mark the 21st anniversary of the 9/11 terror attacks. Victims' relatives and dignitaries will assemble at the World Trade Centre in New York, the Pentagon and a field in Pennsylvania where hijacked jets crashed in 2001. The New York City Police Department tweeted, "We...continue to lose [brothers and sisters] from 9/11-related illnesses.''

60.title: To go with Chahar would be beneficial: Gavaskar on squad for T20 WC
60.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said pacer Deepak Chahar should be included in India's squad for the upcoming T20 WC in Australia. "There will be extra bounce with the kind of movement that Deepak generates with the new ball. He's somebody who's got to factor in," stated Gavaskar. Chahar played against Afghanistan in Asia Cup and conceded 28 runs.

61.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' successful beyond our expectations: KC Venugopal
61.article_body: Congress leader KC Venugopal on Sunday said that so far the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has been "successful beyond our expectations". Furthermore, he said, "We didn't imagine Tamil Nadu would give such a grand reception to this yatra." "It shows that this yatra is going to be the most historic yatra India has ever seen," he stated.

62.title: This is Modiji's freebie: Congress on Satya Pal Malik's 'Vice President' claim
62.article_body: The Congress party reacted to Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik's claim that people had indicated him that he would be made the Vice President if he stopped speaking against the central government and said, "This is Modiji's freebie." "Wah Modiji wah. You turned out to be a great artiste," the Congress wrote on its Twitter handle.

63.title: Warning issued for intense spell of rainfall over several states, list released
63.article_body: An intense spell of rainfall is likely over West Bengal, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Vidarbha and East Madhya Pradesh during next three days and over Gujarat and Maharashtra during next five days, as per IMD. Heavy rainfall is also likely in Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Konkan, Goa, Marathwada, coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, Punjab, East Rajasthan, and South Interior Karnataka.

64.title: Google testing feature to reduce background noise during phone calls: Report
64.article_body: Google is testing the 'Clear Calling' feature to reduce background noise during calls on devices running on the Android 13 QPR1 Beta OS, according to reports. Sharing information about the feature, Twitter user Mishaal Rahman said it works "for most mobile networks" but is "not available for Wi-Fi calling". The feature doesn't send content from calls to Google, Rahman added.

65.title: Clash between Thackeray and Shinde faction in Mumbai, 5 arrested
65.article_body: A clash erupted between two Shiv Sena groups (Uddhav Thackeray faction and Eknath Shinde faction) during Ganesh Visarjan in Mumbai's Dadar area. Police have now arrested five members of Thackeray's faction, and a case has been registered against more than 30 people in the matter. Both faction reportedly clashed over a social media post.

66.title: Odisha village that King Charles visited 42 yrs ago holds prayers for him
66.article_body: Residents of Haripur village in Odisha's Puri district, where King Charles III had visited 42 years ago, have organised a prayer session for him, reports said. A district official said the king was 32 years old when he had visited Haripur to get a feel of village life. "During his visit, Charles enjoyed sipping on coconut water," a resident said.

67.title: Uttarakhand Waqf Board to demolish illegal structures on its land
67.article_body: The Uttarakhand Waqf Board will demolish illegal structures on its properties across the state, the board's new president Shadab Shams said on Sunday. He added that the board's properties worth ₹1.5 lakh crore have been illegally occupied. The Waqf Board will move a proposal to buy or hire bulldozers for the same at its meeting on September 15.

68.title: Small plane with crew and cargo on board goes missing in Congo
68.article_body: A small plane bound for the Kasese airport in Congo with three crew members and some cargo on board failed to reach its destination on Saturday, a provincial minister said on Sunday. A search operation is underway to locate the missing plane, the minister added. Communication with the aircraft was lost after its take-off on Saturday morning, as per authorities.

69.title: Iran's Revolutionary Guards seize foreign ship for smuggling fuel
69.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards have seized a foreign vessel for allegedly smuggling 757,000 litres of diesel out of the country, Iranian state media reported. The ship's seven crew members, all foreign nationals, have reportedly been handed over to legal authorities. Due to highly subsidised fuel prices and a slump in its currency, Iran has been witnessing a rise in fuel smuggling.

70.title: I had indications I will be made VP, if I don't speak against Centre: Satya Pal Malik
70.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik has claimed that people had indicated to him that he would be made the Vice President of India if he stopped speaking against the government. "I already had indications that I will be made (Vice President), if I don't speak, but I don't do this, I speak what I feel," he said.

71.title: Avesh would be falling out of favour with Bumrah, Harshal coming back: Uthappa
71.article_body: Indian batter Robin Uthappa has said Avesh Khan would "definitely be falling out of favour" when India's squad for the T20 World Cup is announced. "I think they will go with five fast bowlers...and I think Arshdeep and Deepak Chahar will be the other two outside of Bumrah, Bhuvneshwar and Harshal. Hardik plays as the sixth fast bowler," added Uthappa.

72.title: Kejriwal has no right to remain in CM's chair: BJP on alleged bus scam
72.article_body: Commenting on the alleged corruption in the procurement of 1,000 low-floor buses by DTC, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has no right to remain in CM's chair. "Kejriwal and corruption have become synonymous," Bhatia added. "In Delhi, tenders are prepared by friends of the Kejriwal government," he stated.

73.title: 58 CEOs of top-notch global firms are of Indian-origin: Sitharaman
73.article_body: While addressing the convocation event at IIITDM, Kancheepuram, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that 58 CEOs of top-notch global companies are of Indian-origin. She added that 25% of Silicon Valley startups are managed by Indians. Sitharaman also pointed out that the number of Indian CEOs on S&P's top 500 companies list is only next to the figure from the US.

74.title: 2 criminals stab each other at hospital in Thane, both severely injured
74.article_body: Two criminals stabbed each other with knives and blades in Indira Gandhi Memorial (IGM) hospital in Bhiwandi, Thane and broke equipment and destroyed patient's register on Saturday, IGM hospital's supervisor said. The first criminal went to IGM hospital for treatment, and after getting this information, the second came to attack him in hospital. Both were severely injured during the fight.

75.title: Khap Mahapanchayat held in Haryana to seek CBI probe in Sonali death case
75.article_body: A Khap Mahapanchayat was held in Haryana's Hisar on Sunday, demanding a CBI inquiry into the death of TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat in Goa last month. Sonali's daughter Yashodhara Phogat said, "We have no hopes from the government now, [and we've] received no assurance from them." A post-mortem report had revealed blunt force injury on her body.

76.title: India has over 100 unicorns with total value of $250 bn: Sitharaman
76.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India has more than 100 unicorns with a total value of $250 billion. She added that these unicorns have also managed to raise $63 billion from the capital markets. Sitharaman also stated that it was a matter of pride that 25% of startups in Silicon Valley were managed by people of Indian origin.

77.title: Man puts fake Google ads for Liquor delivery, cheats 200+ people in Delhi
77.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested a 23-year-old man for allegedly cheating more than 200 people by putting up fake Google advertisements promising to deliver liquor to their homes. "He used shop names like Jagdish Wines, Discovery Wines, and Lake Forest. He has been doing this for a year. The Google ads would run on YouTube," police added.

78.title: Over 500 quarantined after COVID-19 cases detected in Chinese university
78.article_body: Over 500 people, including 488 students, 19 teachers and five assistants, were sent to quarantine centres after a few coronavirus cases were detected at the Communication University of China in Beijing. All of those quarantined were transferred by bus beginning Friday night. China recorded over 1,000 new cases of domestic transmission on Sunday, the Associated Press reported.

79.title: 3 to 6 months required to drain out floodwater in Pak's Sindh: CM
79.article_body: Pakistan's Sindh CM Murad Ali Shah has said that three to six months will be required to drain out rain and flood water from areas in the province, ARY News reported. Shah also told reporters that at least 12.5 million people have been affected by the floods. On Saturday, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres visited several flood-affected areas in the country.

80.title: Mumbai court refuses to discharge sexual assault accused despite -ve DNA report
80.article_body: A special POCSO court in Mumbai has refused to discharge cousin of a girl who was found pregnant in 2020 and had accused him of assaulting her, despite negative DNA report. Reports said that the victim had later said that he had no sexual relations with her. "Her statement... [from] a few months ago, could not be ignored," court said.

81.title: Won't even sell protein shakes: Amit on turning down alcohol brand ad
81.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh, who recently turned down an endorsement deal for an alcohol brand, has said he will not even "sell" protein shakes as they're not good for health. "Even if they give me billions, I will never take it," he added. "I don't need brands which cause unhappiness to my fans, bad health and addiction," Amit further said.

82.title: He has disappointed me: Gambhir on Pakistan batter Zaman in Asia Cup
82.article_body: Ahead of Asia Cup 2022 final between Pakistan and Sri Lanka, ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir said it is extremely important for Pakistan batter Fakhar Zaman to come in form. "Zaman has disappointed me," he added. Zaman has scored 10, 53, 15, 5 and 13 in the ongoing Asia Cup so far. The final will be played in the evening today.

83.title: Pune engineering college student kills 7-yr-old boy after kidnapping him
83.article_body: A 20-year-old student of an engineering college has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and murdering a seven-year-old boy in his housing society in Pune district's Pimpri. The boy was kidnapped when he went out to play with his friends. The accused was allegedly humiliated by the victim's father over his behaviour in the residential society.

84.title: Govt fixes total number of seats in MCD at 250, reserves 42 for SC
84.article_body: Union Home Ministry has issued a formal notification fixing the maximum number of seats of the Councillors in the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) at 250. Of the 250 wards, 42 will be reserved for candidates from the Scheduled Caste category. Earlier, the total number of seats in the MCD, including all the three municipal corporations of Delhi, was 272.

85.title: 126 lakes in B'luru overflowed in Sept due to heavy rains: BBMP
85.article_body: As many as 126 lakes overflowed in Bengaluru since the beginning of September due to heavy rains, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) data. Mahadevapura region is the worst affected with 42 lakes overflowing, followed by Bommanahalli (30 lakes). This could be the first time in several decades that so many lakes have overflowed, BBMP officials said.

86.title: Last reactor at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant halts operation
86.article_body: Ukraine's atomic power operator Energoatom has said that the last reactor at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant has been shut down after the plant was reconnected to the electricity grid. The plant, which has six reactors, was disconnected from the grid last week amidst fighting in the area. Energoatom urged Russia to allow creation of a "demilitarised zone" around Zaporizhzhia plant.

87.title: Woman dies after Redmi 6A explodes at night; YouTuber shares pics of damaged phone
87.article_body: A YouTuber from Haryana has claimed that his aunt died after Xiaomi's Redmi 6A smartphone exploded while she was sleeping at night. "She kept the phone near her face on pillow side and after sometime her phone [exploded]," Manjeet said. Xiaomi said it is trying to get in touch with the affected family and determine the cause of the incident.

88.title: Finished 'Delhi Crime 2' in one & a half days, was stuck to my iPad: Rakul
88.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh in a recent interview was asked to name the last series she binge-watched. The actress named Shefali Shah-starrer 'Delhi Crime 2' and said, "I finished it in 1 and a half days while I was shooting, while I was stuck in traffic, while I [was] coming back." "I was just stuck to my iPad," added Rakul.

89.title: We are ready to bat first if we lose the toss in Asia Cup final: Dasun Shanaka
89.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said his side is ready to bat first if they lose the toss in their Asia Cup 2022 final against Pakistan today. "Toss is very important here, but our batsmen are very good," he stated. Sri Lanka have won all the matches in which they won the toss and opted to field in Asia Cup.

90.title: Will announce a new party in 10 days: Ghulam Nabi Azad in J&K
90.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who had earlier resigned from Congress, on Sunday said that he would announce a new political party in 10 days. Azad was addressing a public meeting in Baramulla, J&K. Earlier, Azad said, "I have not decided upon a name for my party yet. The people of J&K will decide the name and the flag for the party."

91.title: Peon molests 15-yr-old girl in Mumbai school toilet for 2 months
91.article_body: Police have arrested a 35-year-old peon for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl in a school toilet in Mumbai's Grant Road area since July. The accused befriended the victim and threatened her with dire consequences if she informed anyone. According to reports, the accused had taken her number and used to ask her to strip while on a video call.

92.title: 7.6-magnitude earthquake hits eastern Papua New Guinea, 3 dead
92.article_body: A 7.6-magnitude earthquake hit the eastern part of Papua New Guinea on Sunday, leaving three people dead. The earthquake damaged buildings, caused power outages and triggered landslides. Kessy Sawang, a member of parliament, said there are fears of more injuries and deaths due to the earthquake. Prime Minister James Marape expressed concern and urged people to move to higher ground.

93.title: We decided to wait on having a child due to COVID-19: Sonam Kapoor
93.article_body: Sonam Kapoor, speaking about planning to have a child with Anand Ahuja, revealed that they decided to wait during the COVID-19 pandemic as they did not understand much about it. Sonam revealed she told Anand on her birthday in 2021 that they should not wait anymore to have a child. The actress gave birth to a baby boy in August.

94.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin makes 6-hour journey from her home to Edinburgh
94.article_body: The casket of Queen Elizabeth II is on a six-hour journey from her home in the Scottish Highlands to Edinburgh. The procession will give a chance to the public to pay tribute to the Queen. Princess Anne, Queen's daughter, is to accompany the procession. The Queen's state funeral will be held at Westminster Abbey in London on September 19.

95.title: Urvashi issues clarification over viral video after Naseem's 'I don't know her' remark
95.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela took to Instagram to issue a clarification over her viral video featuring Pakistan cricketer Naseem Shah after the latter stated he doesn't know who Urvashi is. "Couple of days back...my team shared...fan-made cute edits (around 11-12) without any knowledge of other people involved in it. Would kindly request...media to not create any sort of news," she wrote.

96.title: Harsha Bhogle names his Team of Asia Cup 2022, includes 2 Indians
96.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle has named his Team of Asia Cup 2022. He has included four Pakistanis, two Indians, two Afghans and three Sri Lankans in his XI. He has named Virat Kohli and Bhuvneshwar Kumar in the team. Further, he has named Muhammad Rizwan as the opener and wicketkeeper. The team also includes Sri Lankan captain Dasun Shanaka.

97.title: Woman falls unconscious on flight from Dubai to Kochi, declared dead after landing
97.article_body: A 56-year-old woman fell unconscious on a flight from Dubai to Kochi on Saturday and was declared dead at a hospital in Kochi, police said on Sunday. "She was taken to a private hospital nearby after the flight landed but was declared dead," police said. Police haven't filed any case as the death was due to natural causes, reports said.

98.title: Pak are favourites to win Asia Cup but can't take the young SL lightly: Akram
98.article_body: Ahead of the Asia Cup 2022 final today, cricketer-turned-commentator Wasim Akram has said Pakistan are favourites to win the match but the "young" Sri Lankan team can't be taken lightly. "Pakistan's middle order...[was] exposed in the last game...hopefully, they come back stronger," added Wasim. Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by five wickets in their Super 4 stage match on Friday.

99.title: Man creates 36 fake GST companies in Maharashtra, generates fake invoices worth ₹132 cr
99.article_body: A man in Maharashtra created 36 fake GST companies through which he generated fake invoices worth ₹132 crore and established network to pass-on fake Input Tax Credit of ₹23 crore. Officers of CGST Bhiwandi Commissionerate arrested him on Friday after conducting search operation at his residential premises. This is the 17th arrest by CGST Bhiwandi Commissionerate in last one year.

100.title: I'm sure I'll be in final again: Jabeur after losing in US Open 2022 final
100.article_body: After losing her second straight Grand Slam final at US Open 2022, Tunisian Ons Jabeur said, "Definitely I'm not someone that's going to give up." She added, "I'm sure I'm going to be in...final again. I'll try my best to win it." Top seed Iga Swiatek beat Jabeur 6-2, 7-6(7-5). Jabeur lost to Elena Rybakina in Wimbledon final in July.

101.title: 54,703 Ganesha idols immersed in PMC's mobile immersion tanks
101.article_body: As many as 54,703 Ganesha idols were immersed in Pune Municipal Corporation's mobile immersion tanks during this Ganpati festival. The PMC has spent ₹1.5 crore on mobile Ganesh immersion tanks and ₹275 for each immersion. Meanwhile, the Pune civic body collected 541,645 kg 'nirmalya' (flowers and leaves offered to the deity) this year.

102.title: 1,132 star turtles brought for sale to B'luru seized; 4 nomads arrested
102.article_body: Karnataka Police have arrested four nomads for possessing 1,132 star turtles and bringing them to the city to sell them. The accused stayed on fringes of forests in Andhra Pradesh and fetched the star turtles, a protected species under the Wildlife (Protection) Act 1972, from jungles. The accused told police they had sold 100 star turtles earlier in Mumbai.

103.title: Talking about Rahul's t-shirt shows BJP's intellectual bankruptcy: Patole
103.article_body: Congress leader Nana Patole said that talking about party leader Rahul Gandhi's t-shirt shows BJP's "intellectual bankruptcy". "What about [PM] Modi who wears suit [worth] ₹10 lakh and glasses [worth] ₹1.5 lakh?" Patole asked. His statement came after BJP shared a picture of Rahul wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which purportedly costs ₹41,257, while on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

104.title: 19-yr-old boy kidnaps, rapes 14-yr-old girl in Gurugram; arrested
104.article_body: Police have arrested a 19-year-old boy for allegedly kidnapping and raping a 14-year-old girl in Gurugram, according to a report. As per the police, the suspect, who is said to be the girl's neighbour, had been forcing her to marry him. He was produced in a court on Saturday and sent to judicial custody.

105.title: Islamic State affiliate killed 30 civilians in Mali: Militia
105.article_body: A coalition of pro-government militia has said that an Islamic State affiliate in Mali killed about 30 civilians in an attack on a town in the area bordering Burkina Faso and Niger. In the incident, hundreds of militants attacked the coalition's fighters, forcing them to retreat, it added. "Reinforcements...reached the town where they discovered the massacre," it further said.

106.title: Still open to other partners: Ubisoft CEO over deal with Tencent
106.article_body: French video game maker Ubisoft is still open to other partners, CEO Yves Guillemot said after the company announced that Tencent will soon become Ubisoft's single biggest shareholder with an overall stake of 11%. The deal values Ubisoft at about $10 billion. "We remain totally independent and we can act with any outside company if we want to," Guillemot said.

107.title: Woman slaps security guard of Noida housing society several times, video surfaces
107.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a woman repeatedly slapping a security guard of a housing society in Noida. According to reports, the woman who slapped the guard is a professor by profession and the incident has been reported to police. Last month, a video showing a Noida woman assaulting a guard over delay in opening society gates surfaced.

108.title: Gauri Khan to appear on 'Koffee With Karan 7' finale episode: Reports
108.article_body: Karan Johar will reportedly host Shah Rukh Khan's wife and producer Gauri Khan in the finale episode of 'Koffee With Karan 7'. Reportedly, Gauri agreed to come on the show on the condition that Karan won't ask any questions about Aryan's arrest in the Mumbai cruise drugs case. Gauri will also be joined by Bhavana Pandey and Maheep Kapoor.

109.title: Aus' Peers-Sanders win their maiden mixed doubles Grand Slam title at US Open
109.article_body: Australian pair of John Peers and Storm Sanders won their first-ever Grand Slam mixed doubles title at US Open on Saturday. The fourth seeds beat unseeded duo of Kirsten Flipkens and Edouard Roger-Vasselin 4-6, 6-4,[10-7] in the final. With this, Peers and Sanders became the first Australian duo in 21 years to win the US Open mixed doubles title.

110.title: Institutions need to produce students capable of getting into industry: FM
110.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said India needs to understand what the industry requires and educational institutions need to produce students capable of getting into the industry to serve the country's development goals. Sitharaman while addressing a convocation event said that India’s higher education was no less when compared to global universities.

111.title: 4 new satellite towns to come up around Bengaluru soon: CM Bommai
111.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that the government is planning to build four satellite towns around Bengaluru and six integrated towns in the state. Devanahalli, Nelamangala, Doddaballapur and one other town will be developed as satellite towns, he said. "Population is showing exponential growth and there is a need to create infrastructure for connecting Bengaluru," he added.

112.title: Wanted Kareena to play Swara's role in 'Jahaan Chaar Yaar': Producer
112.article_body: 'Jahaan Chaar Yaar' producer Vinod Bachchan said he wanted Kareena Kapoor Khan to play the lead role in the film. "We sent the script to her talent management agency, but didn't get any response," he said. Bachchan added he later realised that the part "didn't need a top star but a talented performer" and Swara Bhasker fits the role.

113.title: Apple, Google completely inhibited competition: Mexico's ex-telecom chief
113.article_body: Mexico's former telecom chief Mony de Swaan Addati has accused Apple and Google of "completely (inhibiting) competition". In a complaint filed with Mexico's telecom regulator IFT, Addati said they do this by "taking advantage of their monopoly in app stores to tie use of their own payment processing systems for in-app purchases". Play Store and App Store charge 15-20% commission.

114.title: Buses were never purchased: AAP on LG's approval for CBI probe
114.article_body: After Delhi LG VK Saxena approved a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) probe into the alleged corruption in the procurement of 1,000 low-floor buses by Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC), AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj stated that the buses were never purchased. Bharadwaj further said the CBI had registered a preliminary enquiry and the agency could not find anything a year ago.

115.title: 16-year-old YouTuber 'Bindass Kavya' missing from Maharashtra found in train coach in MP
115.article_body: A 16-year-old YouTuber 'Bindass Kavya', reported missing from Maharashtra, was found in a train coach at Itarsi railway station in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. The Government Railway Police received information that she left home after being scolded by her parents. The GRP found her in a sleeper coach of the Kushinagar Express and handed her over to her family.

116.title: Google changes its logo to grey to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II
116.article_body: Google has replaced its vibrant homepage logo to grey to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II, Britain's longest-serving monarch, who died aged 96 on September 8. Google changed its logo in the UK soon after the announcement of the Queen's death. Condoling her demise, Google CEO Sundar Pichai wrote, "Her steadfast leadership...[has] been a constant through many of our lifetimes."

117.title: Smaller cities with own economies only solution to avoid disasters: Zerodha CEO
117.article_body: Bengaluru-based Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath said the "only real solution" to avoid disasters in large Indian cities is to "have many smaller cities with their own economies". He tweeted, "Most large Indian cities weren't built...to handle as many people living in them today." Kamath's statement comes after flooding in Bengaluru prompted many people to travel to office on tractors recently.

118.title: We didn't adequately celebrate achievements of Indian scientists: PM
118.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that the accomplishments of Indian scientists during the last century were not celebrated adequately. He was virtually inaugurating the Centre-State Science Conclave at Gujarat Science City on Saturday. "The celebration of...small and big achievements of the Indian scientists will create a leaning towards science and will help us in this 'Amrit Kal'," he said.

119.title: Filmmaker Rajiv Rai makes comeback after 18 years with 'Zora'
119.article_body: Director Rajiv Rai, who has previously helmed films such as 'Tridev' (1989), 'Mohra' (1994) and 'Gupt' (1997), is returning to filmmaking after 18 years with "whodunnit suspense murder mystery", titled 'Zora'. Calling it an "ambitious venture", Rajiv said the film "was experimental in every way". He said it will introduce 40 new actors from diverse regions of India.

120.title: Mastermind behind China-linked shell firms arrested while trying to flee India
120.article_body: The Serious Fraud Investigation Office has arrested a man believed to be the mastermind behind racket involving incorporation of large number of shell companies with Chinese links in India. The man, identified as Dorste, was arrested in Gaya while trying to escape India, the Ministry of Corporate Affairs said. The arrest comes after the Ministry conducted search and seizure operations.

121.title: Support to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has left BJP shocked: Ashok Gehlot
121.article_body: Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot said that the public support for Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has left the BJP shocked. "It is very surprising that the statements made by…Amit Shah in Jodhpur...are factually incorrect," Gehlot said. His remark came after Shah in Jodhpur said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi needs to study the country’s history first.

122.title: My mother slept in middle of ‘Tumbbad’ premiere at Venice: Sohum Shah
122.article_body: Sohum Shah revealed that his mother "slept in the middle" of 'Tumbbad' at its premiere at the Venice Film Festival. He recalled when she came out, she asked him about the kind of films he was making. Talking about his career, Shah said he wanted to do commercial films, but only 'Maharani' turned out to be his "most massy project".

123.title: Congress sends 10 dosas to Tejasvi Surya after viral video amid B'luru flood
123.article_body: Members of Karnataka Congress sent 10 different dosas from Bengaluru's popular restaurants to BJP leader Tejasvi Surya alleging that he is only worried about the popularity of restaurants and not about people. Earlier, Congress shared a purported video of the Bengaluru south MP enjoying a masala dosa at a local eatery during Bengaluru floods and called him apathetic.

124.title: Disney CEO rejects billionaire Loeb's call to sell or spin off ESPN
124.article_body: Walt Disney CEO Bob Chapek has rejected billionaire activist investor Daniel Loeb's call to sell or spin off ESPN. Chapek added that earlier this year, Disney saw interest from companies seeking to buy the network. "If everyone wants to come in and buy it or spin it with us, I think that says something about its potential," Chapek added.

125.title: You can experiment in bilateral series but not in Asia Cup: Vengsarkar
125.article_body: Ex-Team India chief selector Dilip Vengsarkar has criticised Team India management for "experiments" with the playing XI combination in "big tournaments" like the Asia Cup 2022. "You can experiment maybe in a bilateral series, but the Asia Cup and the World Cup, these are major tournaments. In these tournaments, you need to win," he stated.

126.title: Growing up, thought chronic anxiety was normal: Bella Hadid
126.article_body: Model Bella Hadid said that growing up, she thought having chronic anxiety was normal and didn't realise she needed therapy. Hadid also spoke about suffering from body dysmorphia during her early days of modelling. "During that part of my life, I was so out of body, disassociating so much...I was so confused by what people saw of me," she said.

127.title: 'Brahmāstra' earns over ₹160 crore worldwide in 2 days
127.article_body: The makers of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt starrer 'Brahmāstra Part One: Shiva' have announced that their two-day box office collection worldwide has crossed ₹160 crore. "Thank you to all our audiences, for spreading Love and Light in Cinemas this weekend," the makers tweeted. The film opened at worldwide gross collection of ₹75 crore, the makers had announced on Saturday.

128.title: We forcefully played in wet conditions: Harmanpreet on 9-wicket loss to England
128.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur said they were not able to get the runs they were expecting in the first T20I against England as they "forcefully played" in wet conditions. "Conditions were not 100 per cent fit to play," stated Harmanpreet. Notably, India's Radha Yadav picked up a shoulder injury while fielding and left the field during the game.

129.title: India can become a powerhouse driving global growth by 2047: Goyal
129.article_body: While addressing the business community of Southern California, Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said the Confederation of Indian Industry estimated that India will be a $35-45 trillion economy in 2047. "India...in 2047 can be seen as a powerhouse driving global growth," Goyal added. Goyal invited the business community to invest in India during the nation's "golden period".

130.title: Mumbai college principal booked for casteist remarks against student
130.article_body: The principal of a Mumbai college has been booked for allegedly making casteist remarks against a student. The student in her complaint stated she was humiliated in front of the entire class. The prosecution also alleged that the accused sent an objectionable link to students. However, the principal said that the link was part of the curriculum on sex education.

131.title: 6.1 magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia; 200 evacuated, 1 injured
131.article_body: About 200 people were evacuated to higher ground after an earthquake of magnitude 6.1 hit the islands in western Indonesia on Sunday, according to the country's national disaster management agency. One person was injured by falling wood and some properties were damaged due to the earthquake, the agency said. There was no danger of a tsunami.

132.title: 12 kg gold worth ₹5.38 cr being smuggled in belt seized at Mumbai airport
132.article_body: Mumbai Airport Customs has seized 12 kg gold worth over ₹5.38 crore being smuggled in a specially designed belt worn by a Sudanese national. Passengers who were part of the group created a commotion to help the accused escape but were overpowered by authorities. A total of six passengers have been detained and six others are being deported, officials stated.

133.title: Warden arrested for sexually assaulting 7 minor boys at Hyd school
133.article_body: A warden has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting seven minor boys at the hostel of Sri Chaitanya school in Hyderabad. The police said that the accused reportedly targeted minors due to "sexual frustration" as he was unmarried. The accused, who was sent on remand, apparently used to sleep alongside the boys and would touch them inappropriately while they slept.

134.title: Admit cards with PM Modi, Dhoni pics issued in university in Bihar
134.article_body: Several students from colleges affiliated to Bihar's Lalit Narayan Mithila University were issued admit cards which had photographs of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and cricketer Mahendra Singh Dhoni. "Students were supposed to upload photographs...[they] seem to have engaged in irresponsible mischief," the university's registrar said, adding that students have been issued show cause notices.

135.title: Clarification, not confrontation: Tharoor after leak of private letter by 5 MPs
135.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor reacted to the letter that five Congress MPs (including Tharoor) wrote to Madhusudan Mistry, head of Congress' internal poll panel, which was allegedly leaked leading to controversy. Taking to Twitter, Tharoor wrote, "I spoke with...Mistry ji...to end the unseemly controversy...I stressed that as loyal Congressmen we were seeking clarification, not confrontation."

136.title: UK PM to join King Charles on Britain tour to lead mourning for Queen
136.article_body: UK PM Liz Truss will accompany King Charles on a tour of Britain's four nations - England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, as he will lead mourning for the Queen, Truss' spokesperson said. In a special Parliament session, Truss swore new oath of allegiance to the new King. Truss was present when Charles was officially proclaimed as Britain's new King.

137.title: Switzerland plans to open nuclear waste storage unit near German border
137.article_body: Switzerland's National Cooperative for the Disposal of Radioactive Waste proposed a plan to build a nuclear waste storage facility on the German border. The waste would be sourced from five nuclear power plants and would be embedded several hundred metres underground. Local German communities along the border are concerned about the issues of safety and drinking water supply, reports said.

138.title: I did not follow 12-14 hours study schedules: JEE Advanced topper Shishir
138.article_body: After topping JEE Advanced 2022 exam with 314 marks out of 360, RK Shishir of IIT Bombay zone said that he did not put 12-14 hours into his studies which is a common practice. Stating that he has been consistently studious, Shishir added that it is not the number of hours but the quality that matters while cracking entrance exams.

139.title: Which startups have seen the biggest drop in valuations in 2022 as per Hurun?
139.article_body: China-based Douyin, the owner of TikTok, saw the sharpest decline in its valuation in the last six months, as it fell by $150 billion to $200 billion, as per Hurun. Fintech startups Klarna, Stripe and Ant Group's valuation dropped by $39.5 billion, $33 billion, and $30 billion, respectively. The drop in valuations comes amid global economy slowdown and high inflation.

140.title: Shouldn't all Raj Bhavans become Kartavya Bhavans?: Tharoor on renaming Rajpath
140.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor, while reacting to the renaming of the Rajpath, on Saturday said, "If Rajpath is to be renamed 'Kartavya Path', shouldn't all Raj Bhavans become Kartavya Bhavans?" Tharoor tweeted, "Why stop there? Rename Rajasthan as Kartavyasthan?" Earlier, the Centre announced that the Rajpath and Central Vista lawns area would be renamed 'Kartavya Path'.

141.title: I was one of the people who took decision to make Shinde CM: Fadnavis
141.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis during an interview said that he knew that Eknath Shinde would become the state CM because he was one of the people who took this decision. Fadnavis said this on being questioned about his post as Deputy CM. Adding that the post "doesn't matter", he said, "Whatever responsibility we get in...BJP, we fulfil that."

142.title: Delhi teachers propose specialised govt school for kids with violent tendencies
142.article_body: The Government School Teachers Association (GSTA) has proposed the Delhi government to set up specialised schools for students with "violent and criminal tendencies". The GSTA has also requested the presence of one police personnel inside school premises during school hours, a threefold increase in the strength of guards in schools and capping the student strength of schools to 2,500.

143.title: 5 Bihar policemen locked in jail for 2 hours for 'dissatisfactory work'; video surfaces
143.article_body: A video of five police officers being kept inside a lockup in Bihar's Nawada has surfaced online. Bihar Police Association has sought a probe into the incident after it was reported that three assistant sub-inspectors and two sub-inspectors were kept inside the lockup for two hours on the orders of SP Gaurav Mangla because he was dissatisfied with their performance.

144.title: India won't go to T20 World Cup as favourites: RP Singh
144.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said India won't go to the T20 WC 2022 as favourites to win the title. "If you really want to earn that trophy, you need to...back the 11-12 players in the upcoming games against Australia and South Africa," he added. "If you continue to shuffle, it will only cause more confusion," Singh further said.

145.title: Unable to see in dark, Gurugram delivery executive hits truck with bike; dies
145.article_body: A 27-year-old delivery executive was killed after his motorcycle allegedly rammed into a stationary truck in Gurugram's DLF Phase 1 on Friday. The man was with his relative but the two were travelling on separate motorcycles. "Since it was dark and the truck did not have any reflector lights on, he did not spot [the truck]," the deceased's relative said.

146.title: Delhi LG approves CBI probe in procurement of buses by Delhi govt
146.article_body: Delhi LG VK Saxena has cleared a proposal to forward a complaint to CBI to probe the alleged corruption in the procurement of 1,000 low-floor buses by the AAP-led state government. The complaint alleges that the Minister of Transport being appointed as chairman of the committee for procuring buses by Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) was done in a "premeditated manner".

147.title: New Vande Bharat gets safety nod, likely to be flagged off on Sept 30
147.article_body: The new Vande Bharat high-speed train is likely to be flagged off on September 30 as it has already completed its 20-day trial run and received Commission of Railway Safety's (CRS) approval, officials said. The Vande Bharat-2 is likely to run between Mumbai and Ahmedabad and it will be flagged off by PM Narendra Modi, senior officials said.

148.title: 1 killed, 20 injured after fire breaks out in Surat chemical factory; 3 people missing
148.article_body: One worker was killed while 20 others were injured in a fire that broke out at Anupam Rasayan India Limited factory in Gujarat's Surat on Saturday. Reports said three people are currently missing. Surat in-charge Chief Fire Officer Basant Pareek said the fire started after a massive blast in a container storing hazardous chemicals.

149.title: I'd go with Pant at no. 5, Hardik at no. 6 & Karthik at no. 7: Pujara
149.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara has said with the kind of Asia Cup Team India had, they need both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik in the playing XI for the T20 World Cup. "I'd go with Rishabh at number five, Hardik at number six and Karthik at number 7. Unless you're looking for Hooda to bowl a few overs," stated Pujara.

150.title: Regularise temporary employees: Kejriwal urges Centre, States
150.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday hailed the Punjab government for regularising 8,736 school teachers and urged the central and state governments to make temporary employees permanent. "People working as temporary employees are right at the bottom of the hierarchy and are the poorest. They are exploited. It is time to end their exploitation," Kejriwal stated.

151.title: Cab aggregators need to set clear policy on surge pricing: CCI
151.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has proposed self-regulatory steps for cab aggregators on surge pricing and revenue sharing. It said cab aggregators should provide customers with general description of various components of total fare mentioning the surge. In case of rude cancellation, drivers should be notified what part of cancellation charge is given to them, the CCI said.

152.title: Will continue our fight democratically for restoration of Article 370: Omar
152.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah said his party will continue fighting "democratically, constitutionally and politically" for the restoration of Article 370, which was abrogated by the Centre. "We're not on the roads or misleading the public or taking the law in our hands for restoration of Article 370," Abdullah added. "I'm not among those who will give up," he stated.

153.title: Rahul going on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' wearing foreign t-shirt: Amit Shah
153.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said Congress' Rahul Gandhi is out to unite the country wearing a "foreign t-shirt". Addressing a BJP workers' gathering in Jodhpur, Shah said, "Rahul baba is going on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' wearing a foreign t-shirt." Earlier, BJP shared a picture of Rahul wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which purportedly costs ₹41,257, while on yatra.

154.title: Delhi civic body allows permits for street vendors to return to India Gate
154.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has begun the process to allow around 120 street vendors to operate in the redeveloped Central Vista Avenue and its surrounding areas. The vendors will return to the India Gate area 20 months after they were removed due to the redevelopment work. Vendors will be restricted to specially earmarked vending zones, an official stated.

155.title: They’ve done fantastic job: Kit Harington on 'House of the Dragon'
155.article_body: Actor Kit Harington said he is "really enjoying" watching 'House of the Dragon'. He said the makers of 'Game of Thrones' spinoff have "done a fantastic job". "It's a weird one to start a whole new show in the same kind of realm and to make it its own thing, and I think that they've really done that," he said.

156.title: Women tell Rahul they'll marry him to Tamil girl; Jairam shares pic of leader's reaction
156.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that during Rahul Gandhi's interaction with women MGNREGA workers in Tamil Nadu's Marthandam, a lady told Rahul they are ready to get him married to a Tamil girl. "RG looks most amused & the photo shows it," Jairam Ramesh wrote in his tweet with the picture. Rahul met the MGNREGA workers during Bharat Jodo Yatra.

157.title: Deepak wins award for 'Good Luck...', says people watched it for Janhvi
157.article_body: Deepak Dobriyal won the Best Actor in a Comic Role for 'Good Luck Jerry' at the OTTPlay Awards 2022. He dedicated his award to his co-star Janhvi Kapoor and said people watched the film because of her. "Janhvi's hold on the youth and her fan following meant people watched this film. That's why I got this award," he said.

158.title: Took time for my brain to work again: Eminem on 2007 drug overdose
158.article_body: Rapper Eminem said it "took a long time" for his brain to start working after his drug overdose in 2007. He was hospitalised in 2007 after overdosing on methadone before going into rehab. Eminem said he "was so scatter-brained" that people thought he might have injured or damaged his brain. "I was in this weird fog for months," he added.

159.title: RK Shishir tops JEE Advanced 2022, Tanishka Kabra topper among girl candidates
159.article_body: RK Shishir of IIT Bombay zone has topped JEE Advanced 2022 exam with 314 marks out of 360. Tanishka Kabra of IIT Delhi zone has topped the exam among the girl candidates with 277 marks. After Shishir, Polu Lakshmi Sai Lohith Reddy was ranked second, Thomas Biju Cheeramvelil ranked third, Vangapalli Sai Siddhartha ranked fourth and Mayank Motwani ranked fifth.

160.title: UP CM suspends 15 officials after fire kills 4 at Lucknow's Hotel Levana
160.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has suspended 15 officials after four people were killed in a fire that broke out in Hotel Levana in Lucknow. Earlier, a probe report had suggested action against officers and engineers. The report also held six departments including Fire Services and the Excise Department responsible for the fire.

161.title: Delhi records 7th monkeypox case as 24-yr-old woman tests positive
161.article_body: Delhi has recorded its seventh case of Monkeypox. A 24-year-old female of Nigerian origin has tested positive. Dr Vineet Rehlan, nodal officer for monkeypox cases and professor of dermatology at Delhi's Lok Nayak hospital, said the patient has been living in India for last four months and had visited the hospital with symptoms such as fever, sore throat and blisters.

162.title: 4 lakh people travel by Hyd metro on Sept 9 during Ganesh Visarjan
162.article_body: According to metro officials, a total of four lakh passengers used the metro services in Hyderabad on the occasion of Ganesh Visarjan on September 9. The officials said that about 40,000 passengers exited and 22,500 passengers entered the Khairatabad metro station. Earlier, Hyderabad Metro Rail had announced that the service will remain open till 2 am for Ganesh Visarjan.

163.title: 'Sanaa' is going to be unforgettable part of my journey: Radhika
163.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan, who has started dubbing for her upcoming film 'Sanaa', called the film "an unforgettable part" of her journey as an actor. Director Sudhanshu Saria said Radhika "went to lengths to embody Sanaa to the best of her calibre" and he "can't imagine any other actor" playing the character. The film also stars Pooja Bhatt and Sohum Shah.

164.title: Ajinkya Rahane scores double ton on return to competitive cricket
164.article_body: West Zone captain Ajinkya Rahane played an unbeaten 207-run innings on his return to competitive cricket after a gap of almost four months. Rahane along with opener Yashasvi Jaiswal scored double hundreds against North East Zone in their ongoing Duleep Trophy quarter-finals match. Rahane had picked a groin injury in IPL 2022 and hadn't played since then.

165.title: Traffic diversions in Pune's Chandani chowk from tomorrow due to bridge demolition
165.article_body: The Pune Traffic Police have placed traffic regulations and diversions at Chandani chowk from tomorrow for demolition of an old bridge in the junction. The demolition will start from Monday (September 12) and will be completed in a phased manner before September 16. According to the advisory, traffic from Mumbai to Kothrud will be diverted via the existing Kothrud route.

166.title: Mysuru MP visits site after Volvo bus skids on B'luru-Mysuru expressway
166.article_body: After a goods truck fell on its side and a Volvo bus carrying passengers skidded but avoided a major mishap on the Bengaluru-Mysuru Expressway, Mysuru-Kodagu MP Pratap Simha visited the accident site. A video of the truck lying on the side of the expressway had earlier gone viral. Several people had shared the video and had expressed their concerns.

167.title: Wow, that's a new low: Kangana on 'Brahmāstra' figures being 70% fake
167.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut has shared filmmaker Eray Mridula Cather's tweet which called the box office figures of Ayan Mukerji directorial 'Brahmāstra' to be 60-70% fake. Kangana wrote alongside a screenshot of the tweet, "Wow!!! That's a new low." Eray tweeted, "Few trade analysts are not giving #Brahmastra BO figures as they're completely manipulated...It's not just ego, it's coke-ego!"

168.title: Pic shows Tricolour flying at half-mast as India observes 1-day state mourning
168.article_body: The Tricolour is being flown at half-mast at Red Fort, Rashtrapati Bhavan, Parliament and other government buildings on Sunday as India observes one-day state mourning following the demise of UK Queen Elizabeth II. There will be no official entertainment on Sunday, according to the statement released by the Centre. The Queen passed away on September 8.

169.title: Players carry stretcher after fan suffers heart attack during Cadiz-Barca match
169.article_body: Barcelona's La Liga match against Cadiz on Saturday night was suspended for over 50 minutes after a fan suffered a cardiac arrest in the stands. Cadiz players Jose Mari and Jeremias Ledesma were seen assisting the officials in carrying a stretcher and a defibrillator during the medical emergency. Cadiz said the fan was successfully resuscitated and taken to the hospital.

170.title: Around 1,50,000 people visited revamped Central Vista yesterday: Police
170.article_body: As the revamped Central Vista Avenue was opened to public on Thursday evening after almost 19 months, a large number of people visited India Gate yesterday. Around 1,50,000 people visited the avenue on Saturday, of whom 40,000 arrived after sunset, the police officers estimated. Parking spaces were full in the evening as a huge crowd turned up, DCP Traffic said.

171.title: 'UP + Bihar = Gayi Modi Sarkar' poster surfaces outside SP's office in Lucknow
171.article_body: A poster surfaced in Lucknow outside the Samajwadi Party's (SP) office with photos of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav. "UP + Bihar = Gayi Modi Sarkar (If UP and Bihar join hands, PM Modi-led government will be ousted)," read message on the poster. "If we see political map, BJP would be nowhere," SP's IP Singh said.

172.title: Canadian Parliament to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II on Thursday
172.article_body: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said the Parliament will sit on Thursday to allow members to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II. "In addition, to accommodate Her Majesty's funeral, the opening of the session will be delayed by one day to September 20th," Trudeau added. In a previous tweet, Trudeau said the Queen was thoughtful, curious, helpful and funny.

173.title: Bus collides with tanker truck carrying fuel in Mexico; 18 killed
173.article_body: At least 18 people were killed after a bus collided with a tanker truck carrying fuel on a highway in Mexico's Tamaulipas, according to authorities. The crash left both vehicles completely burned and pictures released by the police showed that the bus was reduced to charred metal, the Associated Press reported. The truck driver apparently survived and is being investigated.

174.title: Payments giants to apply code to track sales at gun stores in US
174.article_body: Visa Inc, Mastercard Inc and American Express have said that they will implement a new merchant category code, approved by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), for US gun retailers.
