With this, Ram and Salisbury have become the first men's team to defend their title at US Open since Australian duo of Todd Woodbridge and Mark Woodforde in 1996.

349.title: 14-year-old girl married off to 46-year-old man in K'taka; 3 arrested
349.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was married off to a 46-year-old man in Bengaluru. The girl's parents and husband, N Guruprasad, have been arrested on charges of child marriage, said police. Guruprasad is said to have convinced the girl's parents to marry their daughter to him for ₹15,000. The parents told the police that they agreed out of poverty.

350.title: Suggested use of skybuses in Bengaluru: Gadkari on improving mobility
350.article_body: Talking about improving road infrastructure and mobility in Bengaluru, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said that the Centre would study introducing skybuses and building flyovers. "We are working on public transport on electricity. Technology has changed a lot. It's difficult to acquire land in Bengaluru. So, I suggested the use of skybuses like in the Philippines and other countries," said Gadkari.

351.title: Kejriwal govt spent ₹168 cr for over 4 lakh patients since 2017: Sisodia
351.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal-led government has spent ₹168.43 crore to provide healthcare facilities to over 4.27 lakh patients in Delhi between 2017 and March 2022, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Friday. He also added that there are several schemes where the government provides financial support for patients' medical implants, surgeries, 136 types of medical tests and treatment of accident victims.

352.title: Congress wants to loot the poor people of Chhattisgarh: JP Nadda
352.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda criticised Congress and alleged that the party wants to loot the people of Chhattisgarh and fill the party’s treasury. "The Congress government in Chhattisgarh has stalled several ongoing development projects in the state. They never want development of the society. They want to become the Congress party’s ATM," said Nadda.

353.title: India’s Global Innovation Index ranking improved from 81 to 46: PM Modi
353.article_body: PM Narendra Modi hailed Centre’s science and technology-based development model and said that India’s Global Innovation Index ranking improved from 81 in 2015 to 46 at present due to the government’s efforts. "We have to make India a global centre of research and innovation in this Amrit Kaal. States should adopt best practices from other states," said PM Modi.

354.title: Dravid is aware that the honeymoon period is over: Ex-selector Karim
354.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim said India head coach Rahul Dravid is aware that the "honeymoon period" is over. "He's trying his best to be an alchemist but so far, such metals haven't been converted into core," added Karim. Karim stated that Dravid would "love" to swap India's triumphs in bilateral matches with the defeat in the recent fifth Test against England.

355.title: Google pays 'enormous' sums to remain top search engine: US DOJ
355.article_body: US Department of Justice (DOJ) has said Google pays "enormous" sums annually to Apple, Samsung and other telecom companies to unlawfully remain the top search engine. Google spends billions to buy "default exclusivity" on most browsers and all US mobile phones, DOJ told a federal judge on Thursday. The comments come in an antitrust lawsuit filed by DOJ in 2020.

356.title: They'll get tired one day: Kamra on right-wing groups' threats against show
356.article_body: Comedian Kunal Kamra took to Instagram to react to right-wing groups threatening to protest and disrupt his show at a bar in Gurugram if it wasn't cancelled, saying, "They'll get tired one day or I'll be irrelevant, don't know which one will be sooner." This comes as the bar's management cancelled the show. Kamra "mocks Hindu deities", right-wing groups claimed.

357.title: India's forex reserves fall to lowest level in nearly 2 years, drop below $560 billion
357.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell to their lowest level in nearly two years, data released by the Reserve Bank of India on Friday showed. The reserves fell by $7.94 billion to $553.1 billion as of September 2, marking the lowest level since October 9, 2020. The decline was led by a drop in foreign currency assets to $492.1 billion.

358.title: We were probably like dying: Ruud on 55-shot rally in US Open semi
358.article_body: Discussing the 55-shot rally in the first set of his US Open semi-final against Russia's Karen Khachanov, Norwegian tennis player Casper Ruud said, "We were...probably like dying because we were out of breath." "I felt my knees or my legs were sort of shaking," added Ruud. "I tried to not...[let] Karen feel that I am tired," he stated.

359.title: Man crashes lover's wedding in Chennai, tries to tie 'mangalsutra'
359.article_body: A 24-year-old man crashed his lover's wedding in Chennai and tried to tie 'thali' ('mangalsutra'), which he snatched from the priest, around her neck on Friday. He came to the marriage hall after the 20-year-old bride texted him to come and get her. The man was beaten up by people but he managed to stop the wedding.

360.title: Newborn girl found abandoned in Mumbai, people call police for adoption
360.article_body: A newborn girl was found abandoned near a dustbin in Mumbai's Borivali (West) area on Wednesday night. Following the incident, a police officer shared a post on Facebook and a few families contacted him expressing willingness to adopt the girl. "If she gets adopted, it would be great," said Senior Inspector Sudhir Kudalkar, who had shared the post.

361.title: Shah Rukh Khan shouldn't collaborate with me right now: Ali Zafar
361.article_body: Actor Ali Zafar in an interview stated that actor Shah Rukh Khan should not collaborate with him right now. "Wahan pe aise hi mushkilein badh jaati hain (Difficulties can increase there just like that)," the actor added. The All Indian Cine Workers Association had announced a total ban on Pakistani artistes after the Pulwama terror attack in 2019.

362.title: 'Brahmāstra' earns ₹75 crore worldwide on opening day
362.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt starrer 'Brahmāstra Part One: Shiva' has opened at worldwide gross collection of ₹75 crore. Sharing the update, the film's producer Karan Johar wrote on Instagram, "Humbled...Grateful...but yet can't control my excitement!" The film reportedly collected ₹35-36 crore in all versions at the domestic box office on the first day.

363.title: Teabag said to have been used by UK Queen put on sale for ₹9.5 lakh on eBay
363.article_body: A teabag believed to have been used by Queen Elizabeth, was put on sale on eBay for $12,000 (around ₹9.56 lakh), after her death. "This is the very teabag you might have seen on CNN in late 1998. Own a piece of History! Priceless!" said the listing. The listing has now ended and it indicates the product has been sold.

364.title: Charles proclaimed King at ceremony in London
364.article_body: Charles has been proclaimed King at the Accession Council at St James' Palace in London after the passing away of his mother Elizabeth II. The ceremony was attended by his wife, Camilla, and the heir to the throne, William. Later in the day, Senior MPs will swear an oath of allegiance to King Charles III in the Houses of Parliament.

365.title: An adventure for the big screen, can't wait for part 2: Arjun on 'Brahmāstra'
365.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to appreciate Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra'. He wrote, "An adventure for the big screen...A ride like no other...Loved watching @ayan_mukerji's vision come to life." He further wrote, "From...King Khans surprise emergence (loved it) to nag sirs action sequences...this one is a sure shot cinematic experience...cannot wait for part 2!!!"

366.title: Chadwick Boseman honoured with Disney Legends Award posthumously
366.article_body: Late actor Chadwick Boseman, known for portraying 'Black Panther', was honoured with the Disney Legends Award posthumously on Friday at D23 Expo. His brother Derrick Boseman accepted the trophy on his behalf. Derrick said in his speech, "[Chadwick] honoured his scripts with his love, his blood, his sweat, his tears. As he played these roles, he was taking chemo simultaneously."

367.title: Pitiable: Baghel on BJP sharing pic of Rahul's Burberry t-shirt
367.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel reacted to BJP sharing a picture of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi wearing a Burberry t-shirt, which reportedly costs ₹41,257, saying, "This is pitiable...when one party is uniting the country, the party that's dividing...is clinging to t-shirts and khaki shorts." Congress leader Pawan Khera also reacted to this, saying, "Those with shorts will only look at...t-shirt."

368.title: State-run OMCs to run fuel stations on solar power by 2024: Govt
368.article_body: The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas said that all state-run oil marketing companies (OMCs) will run their entire network of petrol and diesel retail stations on solar power by 2024. OMCs, including Indian Oil Corporation Ltd, Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd, together have around 75,000 fuel stations across India that will deploy solar panels.

369.title: India, US to hold next Trade Policy Forum meet soon: Piyush Goyal
369.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said India and the US will hold the next ministerial-level meeting of the Trade Policy Forum (TPF) in US soon. He further said that officials from both countries will firm up more deliverables and newer areas of engagement. Goyal also held a bilateral meeting with US Trade Representative Katherine Tai and US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo.

370.title: Certain people enjoy masala: Rakul on romance angle in 'Cuttputlli'
370.article_body: Speaking about 'Cuttputlli' being criticised for the romance angle, actress Rakul Preet Singh said that Indian films are known for the "quintessential masala". She added that there is a certain section of the audience that enjoys the romance and song-dance. "People want entertainment...If the story is thrilling and intense, a little bit of breather...makes it a family watch," Rakul said.

371.title: I'm scared of snakes, shot scene with real snake thinking it was fake: Big B
371.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that he is scared of snakes and recalled an incident when he had to shoot a scene with a snake coming out of his chest. "They told me that we will keep a fake rubber snake...During the shoot, I was holding the snake...Later I got to know...the snake was not fake, it was...real," he said.

372.title: 5 killed after boat collides with whale in New Zealand: Report
372.article_body: Five people were reportedly killed after a small charter boat collided with a whale and capsized in New Zealand. The accident took place on Saturday morning near the South Island town of Kaikoura. The town is a popular whale-watching destination, while sperm whales are usually seen in the area. Some humpback whales also pass through.

373.title: 'Brahmāstra' ending is superb, but it will take time to build: Neetu
373.article_body: In a video shared by a media account, veteran actress Neetu Kapoor can be heard telling 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji that the film's ending is superb. She can further be heard saying, "It is outstanding, amazing. But it will...initially it takes time to build. But once the film takes off." The video was taken at a special screening of 'Brahmāstra'.

374.title: The real Kohli wasn't batting during the first 50 runs: Akhtar on Kohli's 122*
374.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said the "real Virat Kohli" wasn't batting during the first 50 runs of Kohli's 122* (61) in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan. Akhtar added that he saw the real Kohli bat during the last 50 runs of the knock. Talking about Virat Kohli being a potential opener in T20Is, Akhtar stated, "Don't get confused...thinking [like] that."

375.title: Teacher pours boiling water on 7-yr-old boy for defecating in school uniform in K'taka
375.article_body: A 7-year-old Class 2 student suffered 40% burns after his teacher allegedly threw hot water on him for defecating in his school uniform in Karnataka's Raichur district, police said. The boy has been admitted to Lingasugur taluk hospital and is undergoing treatment. "We have information about the incident but haven't received any complaint regarding the matter," police added.

376.title: At least 3 killed, 11 injured as trains collide in Croatia
376.article_body: At least three people were killed and 11 others were injured after a passenger train and freight train collided on Friday night in Croatia, authorities said. Both trains were pushed off the rails after the collision. The passenger train was carrying 13 people, while the engine driver was the only person in the freight train, Croatian PM Andrej Plenkovic said.

377.title: Police bust Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module in J&K's Sopore, 2 arrested
377.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Friday arrested two people from Sopore after busting an overground worker (OGW) module of the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT). Police also recovered two grenades from the arrested persons, ANI reported. During the inquiry, the detained pair divulged identities of other OGW accomplices, leading to the arrest and recovery of more weaponry and ammunition, reports added.

378.title: Construction material falls on workers in Noida; 1 dead, 4 injured
378.article_body: A 22-year-old labourer was killed and four others were injured after construction material fell on them when the rope tied around it broke in Noida on Friday. The construction material, which included iron rods, was attached to a tower crane, the police said. An FIR has been filed against four people including the construction company's director, Additional DCP (Noida) said.

379.title: India skips US-led IPEF's trade pillar, to join 3 other pillars
379.article_body: India has not joined the US-led Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity's (IPEF) 'trade pillar'. US Trade Representative Katherine Tai said, "I wouldn't characterise it as opting out, India isn't in...trade pillar right now." She added India and US have their bilateral and trade policy forum. However, India will join the three other pillars–supply chain, clean economy and fair economy.

380.title: Yami's 'Lost' to premiere at Chicago South Asian Film Fest opening night
380.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has announced that her film 'Lost' will be premiering on the opening night of the 13th Annual Chicago South Asian Film Festival. The event will be attended by director Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury, Yami and actor Rahul Khanna. The film will premiere on September 23 and will be followed by a question-answer session with the team of 'Lost'.

381.title: Reliance arm to buy SPL, SPTex's polyester business for ₹1,592 cr
381.article_body: Reliance Petroleum Retail Limited, a subsidiary of Reliance Industries Limited, will acquire the polyester business of Shubhalakshmi Polyesters Limited (SPL) and Shubhlaxmi Polytex Limited (SPTex) for ₹1,522 crore and ₹70 crore, respectively in a slump sale on a going concern basis. The acquisitions are subject to approvals from the Competition Commission of India and the lenders of SPL and SPTex.

382.title: Amazon to stop selling seat belt alarm blockers in US, UK after Mistry's car crash
382.article_body: Amazon will remove listings of products that disable car seat belt alarms in US and UK, a day after the e-commerce platform did the same in India. The development comes after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car crash last weekend. Mistry, who was in the rear seat, wasn't wearing seat belt at the time of crash.

383.title: Pics show cards, balloons, flowers at gates of Buckingham Palace after Queen's demise
383.article_body: People in the UK paid their respects to Queen Elizabeth II after her demise by leaving flowers, balloons and cards among other things at the gates of the Buckingham Palace in London. Thousands of people gathered outside Buckingham Palace amid rain. Portraits of the Queen were reportedly posted on billboard screens in central London's Piccadilly Circus and Canary Wharf.

384.title: Mining mafia attacks police, officials in Haryana's Nuh; 50 booked
384.article_body: A police constable was injured after the mining mafia attacked a joint team of police and other officials during a raid at an illegal mining site in Haryana's Nuh, police said on Friday. A juvenile was apprehended and an FIR has been filed against some identified people and around 40-50 unidentified people, a police officer said.

385.title: 14 cows die at Ludhiana shelter, contaminated fodder suspected
385.article_body: At least 14 cows were found dead at a shelter in the Samrala town of Ludhiana district on Friday. Dr Jaswinder Kaur, a veterinary specialist, suspected it to be a case of contaminated fodder after traces of nitrate were found in it. She said that fodder producers spray chemicals to increase yield, which could prove fatal if fed directly.

386.title: Shah Rukh Khan appointed as ambassador by UAE's Burjeel Holdings
386.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has been appointed as the brand ambassador for UAE's private healthcare services provider Burjeel Holdings. Burjeel Holdings is owned by UAE-based Indian entrepreneur Shamsheer Vayalil. This is Shah Rukh's first role as a healthcare ambassador. The actor said, "Meeting employees and witnessing the immense passion and pride they have in their work was humbling."

387.title: Nurse saves baby who stopped breathing on US flight; video surfaces
387.article_body: A nurse on board a Spirit Airlines flight from US' Pittsburgh to Orlando saved a baby who'd stopped breathing midair on Thursday. The video of the incident was shared by Ian Cassette, a meteorologist for Fox 35 television station in Orlando, on Twitter. According to the meteorologist, the three-month-old baby's lips had gone purple, following which nurse Tamara Panzino intervened.

388.title: 4 including 2 minor brothers die after taking 70-80 feet fall as SUV hits bike in Nagpur
388.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after they were flung into air when a Sports Utility Vehicle (SUV) rammed into their motorcycle in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Friday, police said. Reports said that the four deceased took a 70 to 80 feet fall before they died. Among the deceased are two minor boys, aged five and eleven years.

389.title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates 2 mansions in California worth $55 million
389.article_body: MacKenzie Scott, the ex-wife of Amazon Founder and the world's second richest person Jeff Bezos, has donated two mansions in California's Beverly Hills for a total of $55 million. Bezos and Scott had purchased the properties while they were married. Scott received sole ownership of these homes following her divorce from Bezos in 2019 after 25 years of marriage.

390.title: If I was Rohit, I'd tell Avesh 'Tell me if you can't bowl 140+': Akram
390.article_body: Sharing the conversation he would have with pacer Avesh Khan if he was Rohit Sharma, Wasim Akram said, "I'll tell...Avesh, 'I want you to bowl over 140 kmph, if you can't bowl...tell me'." "I don't want...135 kmph line, length bowlers," added Akram. "If Avesh cannot [bowl quick] what's the point of having him in the team," he stated.

391.title: Former RJD MLC's son arrested for misbehaving with DSP in Patna
391.article_body: Former RJD MLC Anwar Ahmed's son Afshar was arrested for allegedly misbehaving with the DSP and others inside a police station in Bihar's Patna on Friday. Afshar was reportedly forcing police to let a man go who allegedly attacked police during a raid. "He (Afshar) said...he'll come back with 5,000 people and give it a different angle," the DSP said.

392.title: If stray dogs attack people, those who feed them could be held liable: Supreme Court
392.article_body: While hearing petitions in connection with the stray dogs' menace in Kerala, Supreme Court Justice Sanjiv Khanna said that people who feed stray dogs "will be responsible for vaccinating them and bearing the cost if a person is attacked". The Supreme Court bench said that a balance has to be maintained between the safety of people and animal rights.

393.title: PM Modi inaugurates 2-day Centre-State Science Conclave virtually
393.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated the Centre-State Science Conclave being held from September 10 to 11 in Ahmedabad via video conferencing. "Investment in science and technology has increased since 2014," he said. "We have to make India a global centre of research and innovation in this 'Amrit Kaal'. States should adopt best practices from other states," he added.

394.title: 1.8-million-year-old human tooth found in Georgia; pic released
394.article_body: A 1.8-million-year-old tooth belonging to an early species of human has been found by archaeologists in Georgia. The tooth was discovered near the village of Orozmani, around 100 km southwest of the Georgian capital of Tbilisi. The village is near Dmanisi where human skulls dated to 1.8 million years old were found in the late 1990s and early 2000s.

395.title: I'm from middle-class family, watched films only when I scored well: Rakul
395.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that she comes from a middle-class family and could not watch all the films that were released when she was growing up. "My dad would say, 'Okay, you score well. So you watch that film, you do this.' So...it was tough," the actress added. Rakul was last seen in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Cuttputlli'.

396.title: Bolsonaro supporter kills Lula fan as Brazil Prez election nears
396.article_body: Ahead of the Brazilian Presidential polls in October, a supporter of President Jair Bolsonaro killed a backer of rival candidate Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva during an argument, authorities said on Friday. The 24-year-old accused has been arrested, police said, adding that Rafael Silva de Oliveira has confessed to the crime. Bolsonaro is currently trailing in the polls.

397.title: Alia Bhatt is the most focused actor in film industry: Shefali Shah
397.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has stated in an interview that Alia Bhatt is the most focused actor in the film industry. The two shared screen space together in Alia's first production venture 'Darlings'. Speaking about her career, Shefali said her potential was not tapped well before she did the series 'Delhi Crime', adding, "Better late than never perfectly describes my journey."

398.title: Please don't leak spoilers of 'Brahmāstra' on social media: Ranbir
398.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, who recently held a special screening of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' for fans, requested them not to leak any spoilers on social media. He can be heard saying in a video, "The audience who has not seen it would like to experience it." Ranbir also signed autographs and clicked selfies with fans at the event.

399.title: Ex-Tesla CFO Deepak Ahuja to join US drone delivery startup Zipline
399.article_body: Ex-Tesla CFO Deepak Ahuja will join San Francisco-based drone delivery startup Zipline as its first Chief Business and Financial Officer. "Rarely do I see this level of disruption and impact paired with the world-class technology that Zipline's team is building," Ahuja said. He'll be leaving his post of CFO at Alphabet's Verily Life Sciences to join Zipline on September 30.

400.title: 3 people try to sell baby girl for ₹4.5 lakh, arrested in Faridabad
400.article_body: Haryana CM's Flying Squad has arrested three people after they were caught red-handed while trying to sell a six-month-old girl in Faridabad. A member of the squad had posed as a buyer and the trio agreed to sell the baby for ₹4.5 lakh, officials said. The trio revealed that they'd sold a child earlier in Delhi, a sub-inspector said.
